Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util

Interface SecureString

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SecureByteArray, SecureContainer
    public interface SecureString
extends SecureByteArray
    Secure string interface. Builds on top of the secure byte array by adding string related utilities.
    Since:
    4.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      SecureString append​(SecureString data)
      Append a secure string to this secure string object.
      SecureString clone()
      Creates a clone of this secure string object.
      int stringLength()
      Retrieves the length of the text stored in this secure string object.
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the data carried by this object.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureByteArray

        length, toByteArray

      • Methods inherited from interface com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureContainer

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the data carried by this object. The data are internally still stored as a byte array. The conversion is done using the specified encoding which can optionally be passed the corresponding factory method (UTF8 is the default one).
        WARNING:
        This method creates an immutable string which can be a potential security issue. In Java, there is no simple way how to wipe this string from memory.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the data carried by this object.

      • stringLength

        int stringLength()
        Retrieves the length of the text stored in this secure string object.
        Returns:
        The number of characters of the contained text.

      • append

        SecureString append​(SecureString data)
        Append a secure string to this secure string object.
        Attention:
        The secure string objects created with the custom string encoding MUST NOT be concatenated.
        Parameters:
        data - The secure string to append to this secure string.
        Returns:
        The new secure string object containing the concatenation of the two secure strings.

      • clone

        SecureString clone()
        Creates a clone of this secure string object.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface SecureByteArray
        Specified by:
        clone in interface SecureContainer
        Returns:
        The clone of this secure string object whatever implementation it is.
